1.text: And now the younger than I laughed upon me, which I rejected their fathers to set with the dogs of my flock.

2.text: Also the strength of their hands wherefore to me? Upon them old age perished.

3.text: In want and in hunger, barren, gnawing the dry land, yesternight desolation and burning.

4.text: Plucking off sea purslain upon the shrub, the root of broom their bread.

5.text: They shall be driven forth from the midst, they shall cry after them as a thief:

6.text: To dwell in the horror of the valleys, holes of the dust, and the rocks.

7.text: Between the shrubs they will bray; they will be poured out under the thorn bush.

8.text: The sons of the foolish one, also the sons of no name: they were beaten from the land.

9.text: And now I was their song, and I to them for a by word.

10.text: They abhorred me, they removed far from me, and withheld not spittle from my face.

11.text: Because he loosed his cord and he will afflict me, and they cast off the bridle from before me.

12.text: Upon the right the brood will rise up; they cast away my feet, and they will cast up the paths of their destruction against me.

13.text: They tore up my beaten path, they helped for my fall, no help to them.

14.text: They will come as a wide breach under a destroying tempest, they rolled themselves.

15.text: Terror turned upon me, it will pursue my willingness as the wind, and my salvation passed away as a cloud.

16.text: And now my soul shall be poured out upon me; and the days of affliction will hold me fast.

17.text: The night my bones pierced from above me, and my gnawers will not lie down.

18.text: By the multitude of power my clothing will be disguised: it will gird me about as the mouth of my coat.

19.text: He cast me to the clay; I shall become like as dust and ashes.

20.text: I shall cry to thee and thou wilt not answer me: I stood up and thou wilt not attend to me.

21.text: Thou wilt turn to be cruel to me: with the strength of thy hand thou wilt lie in wait for me.

22.text: Thou wilt lift me up to the wind; thou wilt cause me to ride, and thou wilt melt to me counsel.

23.text: For I knew thou wilt turn me back to death, and the house appointed to all living.

24.text: But prayer is nothing; he will send forth the hand, if in his calamity to them a cry for help.

25.text: If I wept not for him being hard of day: my soul was grieved for the needy.

26.text: For I hoped for good and evil will come: and I shall wait for light and darkness will come.

27.text: My bowels boiled, and were not silent: the days of affliction anticipated me.

28.text: I went darkened without warmth: I rose up, I shall cry in the convocation.

29.text: I was a brother to jackals, and a companion to the daughters of the ostrich.

30.text: My skin was black from above me, and my bones burnt from heat.

31.text: And my harp will be for mourning, and my pipe for the voice of those weeping.
